alert.note: Alert for McDowell; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Raleigh; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 5:02AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern McDowell, central Raleigh and central Wyoming Counties through 530 AM EDT... At 500 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Welch to near Boissevain. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Beckley, Welch, Pineville, Mullens, Mount Hope, Mabscott, Sophia, Gary, Northfork, Crab Orchard, Dry Creek, Macarthur, Bradley, Shady Spring, Beaver, Stanaford, Coal City, Prosperity, Twin Falls State Park and Daniels. This includes the following highways... West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 28 and 49. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 120 and 127. Route 19 between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: McDowell; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Raleigh; Wyoming
